str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From telos; complete; neuter completeness.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A store-house for precious things; hence: a treasure, a store. From tithemi; a deposit, i.e. Wealth.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
And, even, also, namely.
Here; used also imperative hither!; and of time, hitherto.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
